title: Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument, Riverside Drive at Eighty-ninth Street.

text:
Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to and including 90th Streets, showing the Bishop Potter Residence.

About 1912.

Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to and including 90th Streets, showing the Bishop Potter Residence.
About 1912.

Naval Review.
Oct. 14, 1912

The fleet at night. Structure illuminated in foreground is Soldiers & Sailors Monument.

Photo News Dept.  American Press Association
225 West 39th St., New York City
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 89th Street (West).

text:
89th Street, at the N.E. corner of Riverside Drive, showing the Bishop Potter Residence.
About 1920.
Riverside Drive, at the S.E. corner of 89th Street, showing the residence of a Schulte. 1925.

Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to 90th Streets. This is the old Bishop Potter Residence, which has been demolished, and a large apartment house now occupies the site.

About 1925.

Brown Brothers.

original_title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - Van Siclen Avenue
text:
Riverside Park, at West 89th Street, showing the Soldiers and Sailors Monument on the west side of the Drive at that point. Buildings shown beyond same form the east side of Riverside Drive, from West 89th to 90th Streets; these two views being northeastward.

July 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - Van Siclen Avenue
text:
Riverside Park, at West 89th Street, showing the Soldiers and Sailors Monument on the west side of the Drive at that point. Buildings shown beyond same form the east side of Riverside Drive, from West 89th to 90th Streets; these two views being northeastward.

July 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Riverside Park, at the foot of West 93rd Street, showing the Columbia Yacht Club, viewed from the Drive.

In the foreground are the New York Central Railroad tracks which will disappear from view after completion of the West Side Improvement Project.

Note the U. S. Naval ships silhouetted against the palisades on the Jersey shore. No. 2 is the same site during the aforementioned construction period.

View 1: June 17, 1934
View 2: June 28, 1935

P. L. Sperr

Riverside Park, at the foot of West 93rd Street, showing the Columbia Yacht Club, viewed from the Drive.

In the foreground are the New York Central Railroad tracks which will disappear from view after completion of the West Side Improvement Project.

Note the U. S. Naval ships silhouetted against the palisades on the Jersey shore. No. 2 is the same site during the aforementioned construction period.

View 1: June 17, 1934
View 2: June 28, 1935

P. L. Sperr
